testHelp

Class verify

  • Object
    • verify

  • public class verify
extends Object
    A collection of static methods to verify assertions in tests. Using verify.that(object) returns some type of assertion, depending on what the object is. Additional verifications can then be chained, e.g. verify.that("foobar").matches("foo").
    Author:
    ejewart

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ExceptionAssertion exceptionThrown()
      Verify that an exception was previously caught and stored in outputInfo
      static void fail(String message)
      Force assertion failure - useful in if statements and catch blocks or replacing non-compiling code in test.
      static void failF(String messageFormat, Object... messageArgs)
      Like fail(java.lang.String) but with but with String.format-style message formatting.
      static void failWithException(String message, Throwable ex)
      Like fail(java.lang.String) but prints message and chunked stacktrace of exception to System.out before calling org.junit.Assert.fail.
      static void failWithExceptionF(String messageFormat, Object... messageArgsEndingWithException)
      Like failWithException(java.lang.String, java.lang.Throwable) but with String.format-style message formatting - exception is passed as format arg.
      static void info(String message)
      For communicating supplementary information about test.

      Verify things about a callable snippet of code

      Verify things about a callable snippet of code - generic version

    • Method Detail

      • that

        public static StringAssertion that(String subject,
                                   String... subjectDescArg)
        verify things about a String
        Parameters:
        subject - the string to examine
        subjectDescArg - an optional description of the string
        Returns:
        a new StringAssertion initialized with subject string and description
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if an exception has previously been caught and stored in outputInfo

      • that

        public static RunnableAssertion that(Runnable subject,
                                     String... subjectDescArg)
        Verify things about a runnable snippet of code
        Parameters:
        subject - the runnable functional object to run (once) and examine
        subjectDescArg - an optional description of the runnable
        Returns:
        a new StringAssertion initialized with subject string and description
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if an exception has previously been caught and stored in outputInfo

      • that

        public static CallableAssertion that(Callable<?> subject,
                                     String... subjectDescArg)
        Verify things about a callable snippet of code
        Parameters:
        subject - the callable functional object to call (once) and examine
        subjectDescArg - an optional description of the runnable
        Returns:
        a new CallableAssertion initialized with subject callable and description
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if an exception has previously been caught and stored in outputInfo

      • that

        public static CallableAssertion that(Callable<?> subject,
                                     String subjectDesc)
        Verify things about a callable snippet of code - generic version
        Parameters:
        subject - the callable functional object to call (once) and examine
        subjectDesc - a (non-optional) description of the callable
        Returns:
        a new GenericCallableAssertion with return type <T> initialized with subject callable and description
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if an exception has previously been caught and stored in outputInfo

      • thatObject

        public static <T> GenericObjectAssertion<T> thatObject(T subject,
                                                       String... subjectDescArg)
        Verify things about an object (used when we don't have a more specific type to verify)
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to examine
        Parameters:
        subject - the object to examine
        subjectDescArg - an optional description of the object
        Returns:
        a new GenericObjectAssertion of type <T> initialized with subject object and description
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if an exception has previously been caught and stored in outputInfo

      • that

        public static <T> CollectionAssertion that(Collection<T> subject,
                                           String... subjectDescArg)
        Verify things about a collection, like an array or ArrayList
        Type Parameters:
        T - teh type of the objects in the collection
        Parameters:
        subject - a collection (typically an ArrayList) or objects of type <T> to examine
        subjectDescArg - an optional description of the collection
        Returns:
        a new instance of CollectionAssertion<T>
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if an exception has previously been caught and stored in outputInfo

        Returns:
        a new instance of DoubleAssertion
        Throws:

        public static ExceptionAssertion exceptionThrown()

      • noExceptionThrown

        public static void noExceptionThrown()
        Verify that an exception was not previously caught and stored in outputInfo
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if an exception was previously caught and stored in outputInfo

      • fail

        public static void fail(String message)
        Force assertion failure - useful in if statements and catch blocks or replacing non-compiling code in test.

        Calls AssertionTools.fail(String message)

        Parameters:
        message - message to include in assertion failure
        Throws:
        AssertionError - with message included

      • failF

        public static void failF(String messageFormat,
                         Object... messageArgs)
        Like fail(java.lang.String) but with but with String.format-style message formatting.

        Calls AssertionTools.failF(String format, Object [] args)

        Parameters:
        messageFormat - String.format-style format string
        messageArgs - zero or more objects to insert into format string
        Throws:
        AssertionError - with message included

      • failWithException

        public static void failWithException(String message,
                                     Throwable ex)
        Like fail(java.lang.String) but prints message and chunked stacktrace of exception to System.out before calling org.junit.Assert.fail.

        Calls AssertionTools.failWithException(String message, Throwable ex)

        Parameters:
        message - message to print
        ex - previously caught throwable object
        Throws:
        AssertionError - with message

      • failWithExceptionF

        public static void failWithExceptionF(String messageFormat,
                                      Object... messageArgsEndingWithException)
        Like failWithException(java.lang.String, java.lang.Throwable) but with String.format-style message formatting - exception is passed as format arg.

        Calls AssertionTools.failWithExceptionF(String format, Object[] argsEndingWithException)

        Parameters:
        messageFormat - String.format-style format string
        messageArgsEndingWithException - one or more objects to insert into format string, with previously caught throwable object last
        Throws:
        AssertionError - with message

      • warning

        public static void warning(String message)
        For communicating issue with test without causing it to fail.

        Calls AssertionTools.warning(String message)

        Parameters:
        message - massage to print

      • warningF

        public static void warningF(String messageFormat,
                            Object... messageArgs)
        Like warning(java.lang.String) but with String.format-style message formatting

        Calls AssertionTools.warningF(String format, Object[] args)

        Parameters:
        messageFormat - String.format-style format string
        messageArgs - one or more objects to insert into format string

      • info

        public static void info(String message)
        For communicating supplementary information about test.
        Parameters:
        message - message to print

      • infoF

        public static void infoF(String messageFormat,
                         Object... messageArgs)
        Like info(java.lang.String) but with String.format-style message formatting
        Parameters:
        messageFormat - String.format-style format string
        messageArgs - one or more objects to insert into format string
